jobs.title: Route Sales Representative (DSD -Direct Store Delivery)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Diversified Botanics is a high-performance wellness company redefining what operational excellence looks like. We value speed, precision, and accountability—and we hire individuals who bring the same mindset to every shift. This is a culture for people who take pride in doing things well, at pace, and as part of a tight-knit team.

What You’ll Do

  • Own and grow a defined Direct Store Delivery (DSD) route across retail grocery, convenience, and wellness accounts

  • Build trusted, long-term relationships with store managers, buyers, and key stakeholders

  • Deliver product directly to stores and ensure optimal shelf placement, merchandising, and compliance

  • Monitor inventory levels, rotate stock, and identify reorder opportunities in real time

  • Execute against route-level KPIs for distribution, velocity, and display execution

  • Communicate field insights back to sales leadership to inform broader strategy

  • Uphold Diversified Botanics’ brand standards in every account, every visit

You’ll Thrive Here If You

  • Take full ownership of your route and consistently deliver on commitments

  • Stay calm, focused, and accountable while managing multiple accounts per day

  • Value quality, detail, and consistency in your store-level execution

  • Enjoy physical, field-based work and being the face of a trusted brand

  • See teammates as partners and take initiative to help them succeed

You May Struggle Here If You

  • Require frequent follow-up or oversight to complete daily responsibilities

  • Disregard established processes for deliveries, merchandising, or safety

  • Underperform without external pressure

  • Are uncomfortable with individual performance visibility or clear KPIs

What You Bring

  • Minimum 2 years of Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) sales experience, including documented Direct Store Delivery (DSD) operations (route management, merchandising, or delivery execution).

  • Industry experience in one or more of our core retail categories (CBD, hemp, cannabis-adjacent, smoke shops, supplements, functional beverages) strongly preferred.

  • Strong route management, merchandising, and account servicing skills

  • Clean driving record and ability to operate delivery vehicles, if applicable

  • Physical stamina and attention to detail in repetitive, field-based tasks

  • Alignment with our values: urgency, ownership, accuracy, and teamwork

  • Located in one of the following areas:

    • Orlando, Jacksonville, Tampa, FL

    • Knoxville, TN

    • Houston, TX

    • Chicago, IL

    • Atlanta, GA

    • Los Angeles & San Francisco, CA

    • Seattle, WA & Portland, OR

    • Boston, MA

    • Nashville & Charleston, TN

    • Charlotte & Raleigh, NC

    • Louisville, KY

    • Kansas City, MO

    • Norfolk, VA

    • Las Vegas, NV

What We Offer

We take care of our frontline team with benefits designed to sustain performance, reward consistency, and support your growth.

  • Health & Insurance Benefits – 100% Company-Paid Premiums (Employees and Families)

  • Mental Wellness & Support

  • Lifestyle, Learning & Reimbursement Programs

  • Fitness reimbursement: up to $1,000/year

  • Tuition reimbursement: up to $5,250/year

  • Professional development: up to $5,000/year

Employee Perks

  • $150/month in Diversified Botanics product + 50% employee discount thereafter

Compensation & Incentives

  • Discretionary quarterly bonus structure

  • 401(k) with 100% match on the first 2%, 50% match on the next 4%

Compensation & Structure

  • Starting Total Compensation: $72,000

  • We provide a six-month guaranteed earnings cushion during training ($72k annualized), after which compensation transitions to performance-based ($48k base + uncapped commissions).

  • Commission: $10 per case (12-pack format) — uncapped earnings potential based on performance.

  • Car Allowance: $500/month provided for business-related travel.

This structure is intentionally designed to give new hires time to learn the territory, build customer relationships, and gain product confidence before transitioning into a fully performance-based compensation model.

Compensation Philosophy

We pay competitively and reward consistency, reliability, and quality. Every role has clear performance expectations and opportunities to grow. Pay rates and bonus structures are aligned with role level, experience, and impact.

EEO Statement

Diversified Botanics is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome team members from all backgrounds and are committed to maintaining a culture where everyone can thrive, contribute, and be recognized for excellence.

Work Eligibility & Accommodations

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S. Reasonable accommodations are available throughout the hiring process upon request.

Ready to contribute at a higher standard?

Apply now to join a team where every shift matters—and your effort earns real respect. We’re not chasing volume. We’re looking for alignment.

Recruitment Agencies

Diversified Botanics does not work with external recruiting agencies. Please do not forward resumes, approach our team, or contact us regarding these openings. All candidates must apply directly to be considered.

jobs.title: Enterprise Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Diversified Botanics is a high-performance wellness company redefining what operational excellence looks like. We value speed, precision, and accountability—and we hire individuals who bring the same mindset to every shift. This is a culture for people who take pride in doing things well, at pace, and as part of a tight-knit team.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead enterprise growth by securing new national retail and distribution partnerships (CVS, Walgreens, Walmart, Target, etc.), expanding Diversified Botanics’ footprint across high-impact channels.

  • Champion category legitimacy—opening executive-level relationships that translate counterculture innovation (CBD, functional botanicals, adaptogens) into commercially credible, compliant, and scalable programs

  • Develop and execute strategic account plans that earn trust with senior buyers who balance curiosity with caution. You’ll act as both educator and deal architect—building conviction in a category that demands proof, not hype.

  • Navigate 4–6 month enterprise sales cycles—owning pipeline creation, stakeholder alignment, and contract negotiation from first contact through close.

  • Conduct consultative, insight-driven sales conversations that translate science, compliance, and brand differentiation into measurable ROI for enterprise partners.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Marketing, Operations, and Product to ensure a seamless customer experience and long-term partnership success.

  • Maintain disciplined pipeline accuracy, forecasting precision, and transparent reporting that drive clarity and accountability across the business.

  • Represent Diversified Botanics with authority and integrity in a complex, credibility-driven category.

  • Travel: Approximately 25–40% domestically to meet with enterprise accounts, attend strategic meetings, and represent the brand at key industry events.

You’ll Thrive Here If You

  • See enterprise sales as orchestration—building alignment across executive, procurement, and operational stakeholders.

  • Can educate traditional buyers on unconventional products without losing commercial composure.

  • Excel in ambiguous, high-stakes environments where influence, trust, and follow-through close deals.

  • Operate with precision and persistence—turning cold outreach into meaningful, senior-level relationships.

  • Communicate with clarity, insight, and evidence, positioning Diversified Botanics as a credible and high-performing partner.

  • Take extreme ownership for outcomes, balancing urgency with strategic patience in multi-month sales cycles.

You May Struggle Here If You

  • Depend on brand familiarity instead of creating conviction through discipline and evidence.

  • Are uncomfortable leading with education, data, and credibility in a countercultural space.

  • Shy away from executive engagement, ambiguity, or the rigor of complex sales processes.

  • Need constant direction rather than taking initiative to architect your own motion.

  • Resist accountability for precision in forecasting, communication, and close rates.

What You Bring

  • 5+ years of enterprise sales experience with a consistent record of new-logo acquisition and complex deal navigation.

  • Proven success managing multi-stakeholder, multi-month sales cycles within national retail, CPG, wellness, or regulated categories.

  • Demonstrated ability to build trust and commercial logic in emerging markets (CBD, supplements, nutraceuticals, or functional wellness).

  • Expertise in building ROI-driven proposals and presenting commercial logic to senior decision-makers.

  • Strong business and financial acumen; ability to quantify impact and drive strategic alignment.

  • CRM mastery and rigorous pipeline management habits.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Enterprise B2B or national account experience with full ownership of pipeline and quota.

  • Command of structured sales methodologies (Challenger, MEDDIC, SPIN, or Sandler).

  • Excellence in negotiation, communication, and cross-functional collaboration.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience selling into national retail accounts (CVS, Walgreens, Walmart, Target, etc.).

  • Proven ability to close six- and seven-figure deals in credibility-sensitive or counterculture categories (CBD, supplements, functional wellness, emerging health technologies).

  • Background in growth-stage or challenger brands requiring market education and trust-building.

  • Demonstrated ability to refine and scale enterprise sales processes.

Ready to contribute at a higher standard?

Apply now to join a team where every shift matters—and your effort earns real respect. We’re not chasing volume. We’re looking for alignment.

Recruitment Agencies

Diversified Botanics does not work with external recruiting agencies. Please do not forward resumes, approach our team, or contact us regarding these openings. All candidates must apply directly to be considered.

jobs.title: Quality Control Inspector
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Diversified Botanics is a high-performance wellness company redefining what operational excellence looks like. We value speed, precision, and accountability—and we hire individuals who bring the same mindset to every shift. This is a culture for people who take pride in doing things well, at pace, and as part of a tight-knit team.

What You’ll Do

Quality is the safeguard of trust. As a Quality Control Inspector, you’ll ensure that every ingredient, batch, and finished product meets Diversified Botanics’ uncompromising standards for purity, consistency, and compliance.

You’ll perform hands-on inspections, document findings with precision, and collaborate with Operations to uphold excellence at every stage of production.

  • Review, comprehend, and uphold all established specifications, procedures, and quality standards.

  • Perform inspections on raw materials, components, bulk product, in-process production, and finished goods.

  • Conduct release procedures, first article inspections (FAI), process checks, acceptable quality level (AQL) inspections, and related quality activities.

  • Document and file inspection results, logs, and monitoring data in compliance with Good Documentation Practices (GDP).

  • Communicate required or recommended adjustments to Operations personnel with clarity and urgency.

  • Uphold integrity in all communications, records, and quality assessments.

  • Maintain a safe and healthy work environment by following SOPs and ensuring compliance with cGMP and applicable regulations.

  • Use modern digital tools to record inspections, monitor trends, and support continuous improvement.

  • Help identify opportunities to improve or streamline inspection processes and participate in training to expand your technical skills.

You’ll Thrive Here If You

  • Take pride in precision and believe quality protects both the product and the brand.

  • Operate calmly and consistently under pressure, with zero tolerance for shortcuts.

  • Communicate clearly and factually, documenting issues with rigor and urgency.

  • Treat every inspection as an act of integrity, not routine.

  • Look for ways to strengthen systems rather than simply follow them.

You May Struggle Here If You

  • Prefer to work only from fixed instructions instead of adapting to new inspection tools or processes.

  • Avoid accountability when errors occur or hesitate to raise quality concerns.

  • Dislike learning new inspection technologies or digital tools.

  • Feel uncomfortable making decisions within clear, documented boundaries.

What You Bring

  • Strong attention to detail and ability to detect variances.

  • Analytical thinking, active listening, and sound judgment.

  • Effective verbal and written communication skills.

  • Collaborative mindset across Operations, Quality, and cross-functional teams.

  • Positive, cooperative, and solution-oriented approach to challenges.

Minimum Qualifications

  • High school diploma or GED.

  • Authorization to work in the United States.

  • Acute attention to detail with proven ability to follow precise standards.

  • Proficiency in documentation and communication.

  • Ability to stand or sit for extended periods and lift 10–50 lbs as needed.

  • Visual acuity for close inspection and detailed recordkeeping.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Prior quality control experience in dietary supplements, cosmetics, or food manufacturing.

  • Bilingual (English/Spanish).

  • Familiarity with cGMP, FDA, or similar regulatory frameworks.

  • Experience with digital inspection or quality management systems.

What We Offer

  • Health & Insurance Benefits

    • 100% Company-Paid Premiums (Employees and Families)

    • Mental Wellness & Support

  • Lifestyle, Learning & Reimbursement Programs

    • Fitness reimbursement: up to $1,000/year

    • Tuition reimbursement: up to $5,250/year

    • Professional development: up to $5,000/year

  • Employee Perks

    • $150/month in Diversified Botanics product + 50% employee discount thereafter

    • Free meals, drinks, and celebration days

    Compensation & Incentives

    • Base pay: $25/hour

    • Discretionary quarterly bonus

    • 401(k): 100% match on the first 2%, 50% match on the next 4%

Compensation Philosophy

We pay competitively and reward consistency, reliability, and impact. Every role has clearly defined expectations, transparent progression pathways, and opportunities to grow through performance. Compensation is aligned with experience, scope, and contribution.

EEO Statement

Diversified Botanics is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including sexual orientation and gender identity), national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic.

Work Eligibility & Accommodations

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S. Reasonable accommodations are available throughout the hiring process upon request.

Ready to contribute at a higher standard?

Apply now to join a team where every shift matters—and your effort earns real respect. We’re not chasing volume. We’re looking for alignment.

Recruitment Agencies

Diversified Botanics does not work with external recruiting agencies. Please do not forward resumes, approach our team, or contact us regarding these openings. All candidates must apply directly to be considered.

jobs.title: Assistant Controller
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Diversified Botanics is a high-performance wellness company redefining what operational excellence looks like. We value speed, precision, and accountability—and we hire individuals who bring the same mindset to every shift. This is a culture for people who take pride in doing things well, at pace, and as part of a tight-knit team.

What You’ll Do

  • Own the preparation and accuracy of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements

  • Lead the month-end close process, ensuring timeliness, accuracy, and compliance with GAAP

  • Develop and maintain reporting that summarizes and forecasts company performance in areas of revenue, expenses, and earnings

  • Serve as the lead for accounting operations, strengthening internal controls, compliance, and audit readiness in direct partnership with senior leadership

  • Coordinate with outsourced providers (AP, payroll, tax)

  • Identify and resolve workflow inefficiencies across accounting systems and processes

  • Support financial planning and analysis by providing accurate historical data and forward-looking insights

You’ll Thrive Here If You

  • Take ownership for accuracy and pride in building financial truth that leadership and investors can trust

  • Operate with autonomy, managing your time and deliverables without close supervision

  • Stay calm under pressure and deliver consistent results in a high-performance culture

  • Communicate clearly with non-finance stakeholders and provide financial clarity across the business

  • Constantly look for ways to improve systems, processes, and reporting integrity

You May Struggle Here If You

  • Need step-by-step direction or rely on others to define your priorities

  • Avoid accountability for errors or hesitate to take responsibility for outcomes

  • Prefer repetitive routines over evolving challenges and growing responsibilities

  • Wait for permission to solve problems instead of acting with urgency and ownership

What You Bring

  • 5–8 years of progressive accounting experience (public accounting + corporate mix strongly preferred)

  • CPA license (or verifiable CPA-track) strongly preferred.

  • Proven track record of owning close processes, reporting packages, and compliance deliverables

  • Ability to manage both execution and oversight, balancing detail orientation with functional leadership

  • Confidence navigating accounting systems (Acumatica or equivalent)

  • Alignment with our values: Integrity, Velocity, Evidence, Accountability, and Ownership

Minimum Qualifications

  • CPA license

  • Prior experience in growth-stage or pre-IPO company

  • Relevant accounting experience in a fast-paced, process-oriented environment

  • Ability to independently manage close cycles and reporting deliverables

  • Strong communication skills and problem-solving judgment

  • Familiarity with GAAP, SOPs, and accounting systems

  • Demonstrated ability to collaborate cross-functionally

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience managing junior staff or external vendors

  • History of implementing process improvements and system upgrades

What We Offer

  • Health & Insurance Benefits

    • 100% Company-Paid Premiums (Employees and Families)

    • Mental Wellness & Support

  • Lifestyle, Learning & Reimbursement Programs

    • Fitness reimbursement: up to $1,000/year

    • Tuition reimbursement: up to $5,250/year

    • Professional development: up to $5,000/year

  • Employee Perks

    • $150/month in Diversified Botanics product + 50% employee discount thereafter

    • Free meals, drinks, and celebration days

  • Compensation & Incentives

    • Discretionary quarterly bonus structure

    • 401(k) with 100% match on the first 2%, 50% match on the next 4%

Compensation Philosophy
